newsitem.title: ZAIRE: Tshisekedi rejects new Congo government.
newsitem.headline: Tshisekedi rejects new Congo government.

text.p: Opposition leader Etienne Tshisekedi said on Friday he did not recognise the new government formed by Democratic Republic of Congo's self-proclaimed president, Laurent Kabila.
"This government doesn't exist for me. I ask all the people to resist with their last energy all attempts to impose a government without popular legitimacy," Tshisekedi told a news conference.

But Tshisekedi, who was excluded from the partial government announced by Kabila on Thursday night, said he still hoped to meet the new strongman, whose forces captured Kinshasa last weekend after a seven-month armed campaign.
Tshisekedi commands a huge popular following in Kinshasa and was the leading civilian foe of dictator Mobutu Sese Seko, whose 32-year rule was swept aside by Kabila's forces.
Tshisekedi's followers who expected him to be named prime minister took to the streets on Friday denouncing Kabila's government.
